item.title: Connecting Birdleaf To MailChimp Using Zapier
item.dc:creator: Cian Brassil
item.description:
We recently launched our first 3rd party integration – Zapier! Using Zapier, you can connect Birdleaf to over 500 other services to automatically add emails to and export data from Birdleaf. A common request has been to automatically add new MailChimp signups to a list in Birdleaf. All this is now possible, and can be set [...]

The post Connecting Birdleaf To MailChimp Using Zapier appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
We recently launched our first 3rd party integration – Zapier! Using Zapier, you can connect Birdleaf to over 500 other services to automatically add emails to and export data from Birdleaf. A common request has been to automatically add new MailChimp signups to a list in Birdleaf.

All this is now possible, and can be set up in just a few minutes! Before getting started, there are some quick necessary steps like getting your Zapier key which are covered in a previous post, so check that out before going any further here

Right, let’s get to it…

  1. Sign in to your Zapier account, or click this link if you haven’t accepted an invite to add Birdleaf to Zapier yet.
  2. Click ‘Make a Zap’ on the right of the dashboard area.
  3. Click ‘Choose a Trigger App’ and select MailChimp.
  4. Click ‘Choose a Trigger’ and select ‘New Subscriber’.
  5. From ‘Choose an Action App’ select Birdleaf.
  6. Then click ‘Choose an Action’ and select ‘Add Email Address’. Your setup should look like this so far – 
  7. Click ‘Choose a Mailchimp Account’. Select an existing Mailchimp account from the dropdown menu, or connect a new one. There’s a help article for this here if you need a hand.
  8. Click ‘Choose a Birdleaf Account’. If you already have a Birdleaf account linked, choose that account, or you can connect a new Birdleaf account. To connect an account, in the pop up box first name your Birdleaf account. Then, under ‘API Key’ enter the Zapier key given to you in your Birdleaf Account page. If you need help getting your key, see here.
  9. Nearly there! Under ‘Filter Mailchimp Triggers’, select the list in your Mailchimp account which you would like emails to be added from. In the picture below we’ve chosen our ‘Newsletter Subscribers’ list, so any emails added to that list (when someone signs up to our newsletter) will be sent to Birdleaf.We also only want to send subscribers that we get an email for. This is likely to be pretty much every subscriber, but you can optionally add a ‘Custom Filter’ to make sure only ones with emails are sent (see above picture).
  10. Now we need to tell Birdleaf what to do with the info from MailChimp. Select the list in Birdleaf where you would like your MailChimp subscribers to be added. You also need to let Birdleaf know which MailChimp field is the email address, so we know what to look up! Under ‘Email’ click ‘Insert Fields’, the select ‘Email’.
  11. Before finishing you can optionally test your connection to make sure everything is working.
  12. Finally, give your Zap a name and turn it on! Once it’s turned on, new subscribers to that MailChimp list will automatically be added to your Birdleaf account and researched!

I hope this helps! If you have any questions please leave a comment below, email us, or contact us through the in-app support chat

The post Connecting Birdleaf To MailChimp Using Zapier appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: How To Use Zapier With Birdleaf
item.dc:creator: Cian Brassil
item.description:
Our Zapier integration is here! One of the top requests for Birdleaf has been to integrate with 3rd party tools. People wanted a way for emails to be automatically added to Birdleaf, and insights to be automatically exported to other tools. We chose to integrate with Zapier first, as this connects Birdleaf to the 500+ services they have integrations with. So, [...]

The post How To Use Zapier With Birdleaf appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
Our Zapier integration is here! One of the top requests for Birdleaf has been to integrate with 3rd party tools. People wanted a way for emails to be automatically added to Birdleaf, and insights to be automatically exported to other tools. We chose to integrate with Zapier first, as this connects Birdleaf to the 500+ services they have integrations with.

So, from today, you can connect Birdleaf to Salesforce, Mailchimp, Intercom, HubSpot and many, many more!

To get started:

  1. First you’ll need to have a Zapier account – you can sign up here.
  2. Next you’ll need your unique Zapier key from Birdleaf (you’ll add this key in Zapier to allow them to connect to you Birdleaf account). To get your key, visit your Account page, and click ‘Generate Key’ (see picture below).You now have a unique key to connect your Birdleaf account to Zapier.
  3. Finally, our Zapier integration is still in private beta, so you’ll need to click the big button below to get access to Birdleaf in Zapier. (We’ll also send you an access link in a message when you generate your Zapier key in the Account page, so you have a copy).
Add Birdleaf To My Zapier Account Now!

Now you’re ready to get started! If you’ve used Zapier before, you can connect Birdleaf just like an other app. If you need some help getting started, we have a walkthrough on how to connect Birdleaf to Mailchimp using Zapier here as an example.

We’d love to hear any feedback you have when using it to help us improve our integration going forward. If you have any questions feel free to comment below, send us an email, or drop us a message in the in-app support chat. Enjoy!

The post How To Use Zapier With Birdleaf appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: Manage Multiple Lists Of Emails
item.dc:creator: birdleaf
item.description:
For a while now the biggest requested feature from all our customers was the ability to manage multiple lists of emails. Today we’ve added the ability to quickly create, rename and delete lists of emails from anywhere in Birdleaf  Here’s how it works: Click the dropdown at the top of the screen to see the list menu. [...]

The post Manage Multiple Lists Of Emails appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
For a while now the biggest requested feature from all our customers was the ability to manage multiple lists of emails. Today we’ve added the ability to quickly create, rename and delete lists of emails from anywhere in Birdleaf 

Here’s how it works:

  1. Click the dropdown at the top of the screen to see the list menu.
  2. Type in the name of your new list (e.g. ‘Top Customers’) and click the green tick.
  3. You will be brought to the ‘Add Emails‘ page to add some emails to your new list. (There’s help on that here if needed.)
  4. The emails will be added to that list. You can now visit the Analytics and Raw Data pages to see data for the emails in that list.
  5. From any page, click the drop down menu at the top to switch to a different list. To rename or delete a list just click the pencil or bin icons beside any list name.

The ‘All Emails’ list shows every email added to every list you have. This is a special, permanent list that can’t be deleted or renamed.

Show Added Files

The add emails page also now shows you the files have been added to that list in the past, to allow you to quickly see what you’ve put into each list.

 

Check Your Usage

The ‘Add Emails‘ and ‘Account‘ pages both now show the amount of emails you can add on your current plan, and how much you’ve added so far between all your lists.

When you first log in to check out multiple lists all your emails added to date will be in a list named ‘default’. Feel free to rename, add-to or delete this as you get started with your own lists.

As always, we’d love to hear your feedback on this, and any ideas on how we can improve even more. Thanks for all the suggestions so far – we’re hard at work on the next improvements already

 

The post Manage Multiple Lists Of Emails appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: Getting Started with Birdleaf
item.dc:creator: birdleaf
item.description:
Getting Started To get started on Birdleaf all you need to do is upload a spreadsheet containing email addresses. Here is a step-by-step guide in creating an account and getting your first email addresses analyzed. Before You Start To get started on Birdleaf you’ll need to have a spreadsheet with some email addresses ready to [...]

The post Getting Started with Birdleaf appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
Getting Started

To get started on Birdleaf all you need to do is upload a spreadsheet containing email addresses. Here is a step-by-step guide in creating an account and getting your first email addresses analyzed.

Before You Start

To get started on Birdleaf you’ll need to have a spreadsheet with some email addresses ready to upload to Birdleaf. We currently support the following formats:

  • Upload a .CSV file
  • Upload a .XLS file
  • Upload a .XLSX file

 

If you have any other queries about the list format you can check out this article.

Creating An Account

It takes just a few minutes to set up an account with Birdleaf  Follow the steps below, and you’ll start getting key insights on your customers in no time.

1. Give your list a name. This can be deleted later.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

2. Add the file you want to analyze.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

3. Choose a plan and enter your payment details.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

And thats it. You will then be directed to the application where you’ll start getting insights on your customer base straight away. If you uploaded a big list it may take a bit of time to get through all the email addresses. We typically get through about 15000 emails an hour.

If you are need any help with setting up your account you can check out our FAQs.

  • Troubleshoot a List Import
  • Troubleshoot Analytics Dashboard
  • Troubleshoot Raw Data
  • Troubleshoot Subscriptions

 

 

The post Getting Started with Birdleaf appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: Troubleshoot a List Import
item.dc:creator: birdleaf
item.description:
How to import email addresses? You can currently import email addresses to Birdleaf by uploading a spreadsheet containing the email addresses you wish to analyze. You can add spreadsheets in the following formats to Birdleaf: Upload a .CSV file Upload a .XLS file Upload a .XLSX file   Uploading a file When uploading a file [...]

The post Troubleshoot a List Import appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
How to import email addresses?

You can currently import email addresses to Birdleaf by uploading a spreadsheet containing the email addresses you wish to analyze.

You can add spreadsheets in the following formats to Birdleaf:

  • Upload a .CSV file
  • Upload a .XLS file
  • Upload a .XLSX file

 

Uploading a file

When uploading a file to you need to ensure all column names are deleted to make sure there are no issues with the upload.

 

Check the format.

As mentioned above, the only formats thatBirdleaf supports are CSV (.csv) or Excel (.xlsx, .xls). When saving your spreadsheet just double check that it’s in one of these formats to avoid any issues. When a file is uploaded in the wrong format an error message will display.

Uploaded a file and dashboard is empty?

This can sometimes happen if you uploaded a file in a correct format but haven’t deleted the column names. If you’ve tried to upload your list and have been unsuccessful try deleting all unnecessary columns and rows.

If your emails are currently in column A  and you’re dashboard is empty then you can let us know here and we’ll get back to you straight away.

 

How big a list can be uploaded?

If you are having issues uploading a very large list consider breaking the list into smaller chunks of 50,000 subscribers for the upload. If that still doesn’t work please contact us directly.

 

Can I add emails to my existing list?

Yes. You can add email addresses to an existing list or to a new list. Just select which list you wish to add emails to from the drop down menu at the top of the screen and add the file you wish to upload.

 

Can I automatically add emails to birdleaf?

Currently the only way to upload email addresses is through the Add Email section in birdleaf. If you would like to have an integration to a email service you can let us know here.

 

Can I view lists separately?

Yes. You can create as many different lists as you like. For help in creating multiple lists just check out this article.

 

Can I delete a list of emails and upload a new list?

To delete a list from birdleaf all you have to do is select the dropdown menu from the top of the screen and hit the delete button beside the list mane. For all other queries about lists you can check out this article.

The post Troubleshoot a List Import appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: Troubleshoot Analytics Dashboard
item.dc:creator: birdleaf
item.description:
I uploaded a list and my dashboard is empty This can happen because your list of emails didn’t import correctly. You can troubleshoot a list import here.   What data can I see on the dashboard? The dashboard provides you with an aggregate view of you of your customers demographical information. You can see Customer [...]

The post Troubleshoot Analytics Dashboard appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
I uploaded a list and my dashboard is empty

This can happen because your list of emails didn’t import correctly. You can troubleshoot a list import here.

 

What data can I see on the dashboard?

The dashboard provides you with an aggregate view of you of your customers demographical information. You can see Customer Personas, Location, Age, Gender, Job Function and Company Sector.

 

What are Customer Personas?

The customer persona section of the dashboard compares all the data from your customers email addresses to identify common trends and aggregates the data to show you your top three customer personas.

 

Can I filter through the data on the dashboard?

Currently the only way to filter through the data is through the Raw Data section of the application. If you are unsure how to filter through the raw data you can get help here.

If you would like to be able to filter through the data on the dashboard you can contact us for early access.

 

The post Troubleshoot Analytics Dashboard appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: Troubleshoot Raw Data
item.dc:creator: birdleaf
item.description:
Can I export raw data? Yes. You can currently filter through and export the raw data here. For tips on exporting the raw data just click here.   Why is there data missing for some email addresses? This can happen because there is no publicly available information for that email address of the user. Often this [...]

The post Troubleshoot Raw Data appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
Can I export raw data?

Yes. You can currently filter through and export the raw data here. For tips on exporting the raw data just click here.

 

Why is there data missing for some email addresses?

This can happen because there is no publicly available information for that email address of the user. Often this happens when a user keeps all their information tied to their personal email address, but is using their work account for your product.

If you have any specific questions about the data provided feel free to contact us here.

 

Can I filter through the raw data?

Yes. To filter through the raw data you can input a parameter into the text box beneath the field you want to filter. For example, if you type CEO into the job field you will be returned with the emails of those people matching your criteria.

 

Can I email specific people directly from birdleaf?  

Unfortunately we don’t support this functionality. If there is an integration to a email marketing service you would like to have please let us know.

 

Where does birdleaf get its data?

We combine information from hundreds of public websites, social networks, APIs and trusted partners.

If you have any specific questions about the data feel free to contact us here.

The post Troubleshoot Raw Data appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: Troubleshoot Subscriptions
item.dc:creator: birdleaf
item.description:
How much does birdleaf cost? We work on a volume based model so you only get charged for what you use. For more information on pricing just check out our pricing page here.   Do I manually have to pay every month? No. We automatically bill you each month and we’ll notify you with your [...]

The post Troubleshoot Subscriptions appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
How much does birdleaf cost?

We work on a volume based model so you only get charged for what you use. For more information on pricing just check out our pricing page here.

 

Do I manually have to pay every month?

No. We automatically bill you each month and we’ll notify you with your invoice.

 

Is the payment system secure?

Yes. We use Stripe to handle all our payments.

 

Can I upgrade my card details?

You can upgrade your card details by going to your Account page and entering the new information.

 

How can I cancel my subscription?

You can cancel your subscription by going to your Account page and just click “I’m Sure” at the bottom of the page.

 

Can I change my password?

Yes. You can upgrade your password in your Account page.

The post Troubleshoot Subscriptions appeared first on Birdleaf.

item.title: Exporting Raw Data
item.dc:creator: birdleaf
item.description:
You can currently filter through and export the raw data here. You currently have 3 options when exporting the raw data. Firstly you can export all the raw data we’ve collected on your customers.  Alternatively you can just export the data visible in your table incase you’ve been filtering it based on parameters such as [...]

The post Exporting Raw Data appeared first on Birdleaf.
item.content:encoded:
You can currently filter through and export the raw data here. You currently have 3 options when exporting the raw data. Firstly you can export all the raw data we’ve collected on your customers.  Alternatively you can just export the data visible in your table incase you’ve been filtering it based on parameters such as Full Name and Age. Finally you have the option to export the specific data points you want by unchecking the options you don’t want to export.

Just follow the steps below to export your raw data:

1. Select the drop down menu from the top right hand corner of the table.

2. Filter though the raw data you want to export. You can either export all the raw data or export based on parameters such as Full Name and Age.

 3. The raw data will download once you select and option.

Safari Users

Currently if you are using Safari there is one extra step you will have to take when exporting the data. Follow the steps as outlined above. When you select Export all data or Export visible data you will be redirected to a new tab with all the raw data scattered across the page. To download it you’ll need to right click on the page and select Save Page As… from the drop down menu. You will then be presented with a pop up with one of the options being Format.  From this drop down menu you’ll need to select Page Source and click Save. The final thing you’ll need to do is change to the file extension from .txt to .csv. To do this you need to rename the file and simply change the text .txt at the end of the name to .csv and you’ll be able to access your raw data.

If you experience any issues please let us know.

The post Exporting Raw Data appeared first on Birdleaf.
